Defintion: The type of information being stored in a variable. Instructs the device to allocate and structure the required memory.
Type inference refers to the automatic detection of the type of a variable or constant.
The data type of a variable/constant is set at compile time, and cannot change throughout the execution of the program.
The data type of a variable/constant is set at execution time, and can be changed throughout the execution of the program.
Not a Number. Value used when a variable is used in a way that is assumed to be a number, but is not.
Examples (if applicable): E.g. A String value is divided by a number.
